page.title: 01Shepperton Lock
page.content:
In 1810, an Act of Parliament empowered the Corporations of London to 'erect' four pound locks. The one at Shepperton was actually built in 1813 and rebuilt in 1825. The lock is 150 feet long and 20 feet wide. At its shallowest it is 20 feet deep. Roughly 30,000 gallons of water pass through the weirs ten gates each hour.
The lock gates are hydraulically operated during the day and manually during the evening. The lock takes 4.5 minutes to fill. The lock is cleaned every day to prevent the accumulation of algae.
